Reviews.Title: “Very BASIC, close to the station”
Reviews.Author: A-Ego
Reviews.Content: Very BASIC but it is a 2* hotel therefore you might expect. The cost is 59 eur / day, and you might not ask for a high standard. Anyway because it is close to the station I found it really noise, I was there for a meeting in rome and I was looking for a hotel close to the meeting venue otherwise I wouldn't stay in this area. Breakfast apart the hotel category might certainly be improved: a good coffee and a brioches do not cost a lot in Italy whilst they served a really bad English coffee and some bread and marmellades with butter. I would not recommend this hotel unless you are not looking for a hotel close to the station and low price.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: Anna E
Reviews.Content: Good hotel! Big rooms. Clean. Towels have been changing, bath accessories have been renewing every day! Good location. All what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Ninakt
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel was the location, which is very central and close to the station. Other than that it was terrible. I was a tour leader looking after a group of 16. The rooms were dirty, there was ash and burn marks on the walls, the electricity kept on going out, and I even had to coax the staff up to prove there was a burning/ melting light globe. I was worried about the safty of the people on my tour group. Rather than being helpful, the staff were unfriendly, rude and made my job more difficult rhan it was. I have taken other groups to italy and stayed in other 2 star hotels that have been far, far superior to hotel capitol. Had I been traveling alone I would have moved on immediately, unfortunately, being in group meant that we had to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Catastrophe”
Reviews.Author: YoniEyal
Reviews.Content: Ants in the bathroom, no hot water in 11am, breakfast you can skip, and reception clerk that doesn't really want to help. Do not go there!

Reviews.Title: “It was so horrible, stay away...”
Reviews.Author: vitucis
Reviews.Content: We had lovely vacation in Italy, and Rome was wonderful and was our last stop. We stayed in this hotel just two nights. But were very very dissapointed. As some others wrote everything was bad. 1. Service and staff were unbelievable unfriendly. They did not want to help or they did not want to talk. Breakfest staff and service were unbelivable poor. Also they were like angry at oss all the time, like: "go away, we dont like tourists and would like to have our hotel emty rather". I had feling like this. 2. Many stairs, difficult with luggage and baby pram. 3. You can say that there is no breakfest att all, so bad it was. And lady working at breakfest was unbelivable unfreindly. The only good thing was location, it was close to central station and all nice things to see. I understad that it is cheap hotle with little stars, but I would not give any star to this hotel. Because so bad staff working there. Stay away, there must be some nicer cheap hotels in same area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing... Good location but unfriendly staff, poor service”
Reviews.Author: davidloncke
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights. In general we had no troubles, but the personel is neither friendly nor helpful. They are rather arrogant and with low attention for the guests. They gave us the impression of being not interested and ignorant. First of all, at arrival we wanted to arrange our taxi transport back to the airport (because we needed to catch our plane very early - at the time public transport in Rome isn't running yet) and the receptionist told us to arrange that just the day before we would leave. Though I like things to be arranged in time. And after 2 days of stay, we insisted on arranging our transport, but with the same answer. The day before we left (in the very morning) we asked the receptionist to arrange our transport, though he seemed to have his doubts if there still would be transport available. While we went eating breakfast, he supposedly called the service, but when we came back up he only had the message for us that it was full booked and we would need to arrange it ourselves through city taxi. We went for our last day into the city rather worried and frustrated, taking into account we allready wanted to have it arranged since the day we arrived. Though in the evening, when we came back to the hotel, we asked again (to another receptionist) and he seemed to find it strange that the service was full booked, so he called while we were in front of him and in the end, it seemed no problem at all to arrange the transport. The breakfast is eatable, though nohting special (which is said to be common in Italy). It wasn't bad, but not really the greatest breakfast we've eaten (and we are not really difficult guests). There was coffee (waterish), and tea, milk, powder orange juice, bread (rather hard) and some jam, honey and butter (for a Belgian, Itallian butter really doesn't taste great). They also had some kind of weird tasting sweet bread (which my wife liked). The room was rather big, with a closet and a little desk. It had TV with a lot of channels, though all in Itallian (not that it matters, because we didn't go to Rome to watch TV). However it was usefull for the weather report and some news (if you understand a little Itallian) The bathroom was rather small, with a little bathtub/shower, with plenty of hot water, though the bathroom needed some renovation. It had some humid spots and in the floor there's a lead to the drainings which smels bad at certain moments. And when you let go a big quantity of water from the tub, it would come out of the lead. Though, you can shower in peace. Something weird about the toilet is that it was rather narrow and not totally comfortable. For our stay in Rome it was good, if we compare it to the price we paid to stay pretty much in the center, because the hotel is literally at 200 meters from the Termini Station, from where you can connect to anywhere in the city, by bus tram and metro or taxi and to the airport by train, bus (by day) or taxi. Around the hotel there are plenty of little restaurants where the food is OK and payable. Though in general we have to say that the Italian food is not as great as we expected and as you might expect. It's rather overcalled for what it actually is. The ideas are good, but unfortunately the Italians are not really the refined cooks they pretend to be. What we really found good and worthy it's fame is the Italian ice cream. In general Romans are not friendly at all, rather arrogant and mainly to tourists, because when you hear them speaking to each other they use a total other tone and higher level of friendliness. Next time we go to Rome we would consider to stay somewhere else, though in the same area. If there's no other hotel in the same price cathegory and it's the absolute only option, we would stay again, though only for it's LOCATION

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear.........”
Reviews.Author: FunFunFun48
Reviews.Content: Where do i begin?? I went to this hotel with a large number of other people and we found that it was horrendous. The first problem being the fact that there are so many stairs (if you are the top floor you will damage your back having to carry all of your heavy luggage up 6-7 flights of stairs). After the increible climb to actually get to our room you find that it is very basic and not very well cleaned. Noise and heat were both issues as well, the lack of AC meant that you had to keep the windows open all of the time and the room was still unbelievably hot. However the worst thing i have to say was the friendlyness and the helpfullness of the hotel staff. On one occasion a friend and i were called stupid and were told to go elsewhere by the receptionist because we were asking for help. The only good things were the fact that it was located near the train station and restauarants and sights were in walking disatance. Would not reccommend at all.

Reviews.Title: “Get Me Outta Here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kurtg19
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a shocker! The only plus to this ghetto shanty was its convienient location to the Termini Station...just stay away. Rome was our last stop on our Honeymoon in Europe and we were very disappointed with this hotel to say the least. Here are some of the reasons, very dirty and uncomfortable neighborhood, our bed smelled like some drunk had vomited on it the night before and the walls were very dirty and we had ants everywhere in our poor excuse for a bathroom, when I went to take a shower the faucet handle fell off into my hand!!! Oh, and don't expect a nice towell to dry off with, what they offered was equal to a large paper towell. May I suggest going out somewhere for breakfast... because all that they had was a meager, nasty, dry peace of bread and watery juice. By the way we were on the 5th floor and it was quite the trek to get up there everytime because my wife was too afraid to step foot into thier rickety small elevator that seemed to be loosely nailed to the outerwalls of the hotel. If your thinkin' about it... don't do it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by fussy travellers”
Reviews.Author: ABD1
Reviews.Content: Considering this is a 2-star hotel I think you get good value for your money. The location next to Termini was very convenient, and we found the various horror stories about these quarters largely overexaggerated. The areas around any central station can be a bit rough, but we were never harassed, neither did we feel unsafe, even in the evenings. The staff at the hotel were mostly friendly and helpful. There were several nice little restaurants in the neighbourhood, but particularly we want to recommend "Angelo"!!!! Lovely food and wonderful staff! Just turn right outside the hotel and then right again at the next corner. The rooms at the hotel were well cleaned every day, but the breakfast was very boring. Dry bread or rolls and jam. One day we found little ants in the bread! Not very nice. Quite noisy street outside with trams and cars, but we live in the countryside normally, so that was part of the city experience!

Reviews.Title: “Go away from there”
Reviews.Author: charlie020
Reviews.Content: The only positive point is the location near the termini. No AC, we were there in june, it was too hot and didn't able to breath after a small effort. We had to sleep with window open and all that streets sounds: tramway until 1h am, so many people outside, music, etc. Bring ear blocks and some pills to sleep. The door of the shower didn't close and there was a flood in the bathroom after the shower. So many moisture on the ceil and the walls. And you can smell it as you enter the room. The towels are good to dry the dishes only. The breakfast is horrible, unfresh bread and moisty crackers. The coffee is black and green...pouah. So deceiving...

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: katrinab98
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near the Termini train station, but the surrounding neighborhood felt unsafe during the evening hours. The location to the Ancient Ruins was fairly decent though and once you get out of the immediate hotel area it was ok. The staff wasn't very friendly and getting to the rooms was a chore as there were several steps you had to lug you suitcases up. The room was basic and the bathroom was pretty limited. There was a tub and showerhead, but no shower curtain. The tub was very, very small and the towels were pretty skimpy. They do have internet access in the lobby, but it isn't free. Breakfast was pretty meager (bread and coffee). There was a major ant problem in our room and we were bitten by bugs of some nature during the night. Probably wouldn't go back there if given a choice.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont like 'roughing' it a little, then stay away”
Reviews.Author: TonyJenks28
Reviews.Content: Was in Rome for 6 days, stayed at this hotel due to price and location. Right next to the train station and the drop off points for the Airport Shuttle bus used by ryanair. This place is good if you are going to be out all day and night only to return ready to fall asleep within 10 minutes of getting in your room. The Hotel: The hotel is definitely not one i would like to spend conscious time in, just sleep. The rooms arent very nice, and the hotel has no amenities apart from a tv in the room and a pc for people to use (price ok). Breakfast is terrible, but it does the job. If breakfast is important to you, then this is def a no-no. Worst part is having to listen to Celine Dion Album every morning of the week. AAAAaaarrrrrgggghhhhh!!!! The Area: I dont know what it is but the couple of blocks this hotel is situated in, just seem vey shady. Lots of like furtive people hanging around can make you feel uneasy. Was very apprehensive about walking along some of these streets. Overall: For the price and great proximity to the centre, the sites, and the station this hotel is excellent. Just plan ahead, so you a) dont have to have breakfast, and b) have stuff to do that keeps you away from the hotel and the area!

Reviews.Title: “dont bother”
Reviews.Author: mtc10
Reviews.Content: First thing is it in a bad part of town, didnt feel comfortable leaving at night. Room had no AC. Mold on the bathroom walls, very noisy most of the night, very busy streets with the train station and bus stops so close. Terrible breakfast. only plus we found is that it was walking distance to ancient Rome sites. would no stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I was robbed, possesions were in hotel safe for safe-keeping”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the middle of May. There was no in-room safe so I asked the front desk personel about that. I was told that I could check items for safekeeping with them and they would put them in the hotel safe. When I retrieved my possessions, I was missing a gold chain with a cartouche pendant. This item was purchased in Egypt a few weeks earlier for the equivalent of $636.00 Canadian dollars. The staff were not at all helpful and actually rather insulting about the occurance. There were five people who had access to the hotel safe and by the way he responded, I suspect that the hotel manager was the person responsible. The Italian police were called and did talk to the hotel personel but to no avail. I would strongly recommend that people avoid this hotel. Other than that, the hotel advertised a breakfast and we found it to be the worst one we had in three months of travelling in Europe and Egypt. The choices were dry, hard bread rolls, coffee, juice made from dry crystal packages and nothing else. We had also booked a tour of the Vatican through the hotel and would not recommend that either. This tour came higfhly recommended by the hotel but we felt that it was a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Love the trams”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Didn't really enjoy my stay. The trams start at 0530hrs and finish at 0030 hours. Our room was at the front of the hotel on the first floor. The towels were a bit of a shock. Didn't enjoy the hollow chewy roll for breakfast. There were a group of school children staying there when we were there. The shower was very small and the perspex door had a hole in it. All that said you get what you pay for and the staff seemed helpful and friendly. OK for schoolchildren doing Rome on a budget, not good for a romantic break.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel from the internet. To tell you the truth, the photos in the internet concerning the bedroom and breakfast have nothing to do with reality. First of all our bedroom had no curtains, either a fridge. The water was really hot though, and they cleaned our room on a daily basis. I chose this hotel though beacuse it had breakfast. Unfortunately I had to eat outside because the breakfast was ridiculous. They had only one type of bread roll (very dry) and you could choose butter, jam and honey. For drink Coffee and concentrated orange juice. That was it, nothing else. The staff though was friendly and the location was close to all historical sights. However, I think this hotel is too expensive for what it provides. I was really dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: tir
Reviews.Content: Was over in Rome for 5 days for a weddong.Room was very clean.Staff were very helpful - told us good places to eat etc.Breakfast very basic and there was no bar but close to lots of bars/restaurants.Tram stop right outside front of hotel which was quite noisy and started early.Very close to train station.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Capitol Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via G Amendola 83-85, 00185 Rome, Italy
